ratings.comment: For a 2 credit class, you have way too much homework, which must be perfect. One single detail could cost you a letter grade on that assignment. The exams are very outdated and you must study for hours to pass them. No curve either. Kim also acts like a d*ck. You ask a question in class and he replies in a way that makes you look dumb.
You have no idea how much homework it has for a 2 credits class. The lecture is not helpful at all.

Ridiculous. Outdated material, outdated teaching style, and unchanged exams for several years. So this is the reason some people could do the exam perfectly in 20 min: they got the solution from other people who took the class. Yes, they are really hard exams, and the average is still so high, yes that's because some people know the answers before

Manner is from a generation of engineers that had to hand draw everything and he likes to force that knowledge onto his students. Unfortunately he does not adjust his teaching style based on feedback/technology because he's been doing it for so long. He's a nice guy, but he shouldn't be teaching.

Lots of hw and it has nevered changed over the past decade or more. But really a lot. Very bad at lecturing and super condescending. Exams are graded by himself and without any criteria. Horrible professor and is going to retire.

Professor Manner was excellent. As long as you did the homework and attended lecture, you'd get a good grade. He was available outside of class more than most professors and was always helpful when I had questions. His grading system was fair as well. Funny guy too.

Kim is a chill Prof and a really good lecturer however his exams are really toughly graded. Class itself is way to much work for just 2 credits of multiple hour consuming CAD models and hand drawings. If you've never done anything graphics related, this class is going to be a fun ride.

It's a lot of work for 2 credits, but he knows that and he said he has talked to the department but they won't make it worth more credit (can't say how true that is). Learned a few things that seem like the essentials to any engineer you will need these skills at some point so just take it in that stride. It can get very boring

Pretty funny guy. The class itself isn't particularly difficult, as long as you pay attention and do the homework, as well as take advantage of TA office hours and study groups if you need it. There isn't a curve though, and some of the points on tests and homework are pretty arbitrary.
Kim Manner is really not that great of a prof.  He is extremely condescending

Kim defines what he expects at the beginning of the semester and sticks to it. He is always willing to help in office hours and wants everyone to learn. If you don't put in the work he won't be forgiving. He understands that it is a lot of work for 2 credits but thinks everything is critical for engineers to know. Just pay attention in lectures.
Kim knows his stuff and expects that you do too. Tests were hit or miss and homework was tedious at times. Overall, decent class, no easy A though.

Condescending at times. Recognizes more work than a 2 credit class yet still assigns a lot of work. This semester we had 4 exams and 1 quiz. Some exams are very similar to practice exams, others will leave you kinda scratching your head. Self-righteous, thinks his class is the bee's knees, even though you don't even learn how to use SolidWorks.
Awesome guy

A lot of work for a 2 credit class but you should find the material is interesting. Manner himself is awesome. For discussion section, you can basically leave after you turn in your hw - but your TA is so important! Will make or break this class/your grade for you. Please avoid Guru Subramani. Makes things more confusing and wastes your time.
Better hope he likes your group and project

Kim is the man! His lectures are definitely not boring and he keeps you engaged most of the time. Make sure you sit in the front. The class assigns more work than a 2 credit class should; there's homework due every lab. Although, these assignments are pretty easy and can be finished in lab. Try to get Chaman as your TA.

This class is a ton of work for just 2 credits. There is also way too much time spend on hand drawing when we should be using Autocad or NX more. It is very easy to get behind. Also, the TA you have can make an enormous difference. There is a whole section that is basically on their own curve each test.

Manner doesn't need a microphone because he projects so well.  He's very clever and often humorous.  The class is very tedious but most of the homework can be done in lab.  Tests are just like the homework (but slightly more complex usually).  Easy class to get an A in if you know what you're doing (surprising number of people don't).
Doesnt understand that students wont get the example the first time. Way too much work for 2 credits, should be at least 3.

He was terrible at explaining the course material, he actually made it more confusing than it had to be. The class was SO MUCH WORK for 2 credits, I don't know why the University doesn't give it another credit. Also, a good Lab TA is essential, my TA Blair was extremely unhelpful and knew less than we did about the material.

This class was a lot tougher than expected for 2 credits. You'll have a lot of work to get done. He's always encouraging people to go to office hours and you probably should. However, he's critical with people's lack of understanding and he's pretty full of himself. Just make sure you fully understand mistakes made on assignments before the exams.
Condescending is the best description.  If you don't understand, it is your fault, and he'll let you know.  One of the worst teachers I ever had.
Kim manner is the definition of condescending.  The homework is pretty easy, however, each test contains some trick that was never discussed in lecture
Overall good professor. He knows ALOT about the topic and is really excited to teach it and have you understand it. The class is a lot of work for two credits but its fairly easy.

Prof. Manner is an awesome guy. He makes the concepts very understandable and goes through them at a reasonable rate. He breaks things down into steps to make large problems easy to handle. He likes what he does, which makes the class more interesting, and he also cracks some pretty good jokes.
In lecture he reads the assigned readings to you very slowly. Have no regrets skipping lecture.
Fairly easy class, but a decent amount of work for 2 credits. If you're taking it you probably dont have a choice though. He's a genuinely good guy too

The class is a lot of work for only 2 credits, but its fairly easy if you pay attention in lecture. The exams are graded fairly with plenty of partial credit, and prof Manner tells you whats on every exam before taking it. He can be blunt if you ask questions he already went over, but he's generally hilarious and a good instructor.
Blunt, but hilarious. If you have to take ME 231, take it with Manner. Even if you have problems with visualizations, he tells you the concepts covered on exams, and is generous with partial credit.
Lectures are pretty easy to follow. Exams always have tricks that were not gone over in class. He kind of gives attitude when answering questions.
I did not like this class because I was not particularly good at it.  However, some people can just see these things and do not have to pay attention or do much at all.

Very magnanimous and very, VERY good at teaching this course, although I think it's stupid that it's only worth 2 credits.  All you have to do is pay attention in lecture and finish the homework in lab and you'll get an A with virtually no outside homework or studying. Plus, if you have questions, he's very good at answering them.

Lectures tell you pretty much everything you need to know. Labs are required. The class was a little bit more work than a 2-credit class should be though. Exams weren't that bad. Shouldn't really matter though since he is the only professor teaching the class

Prof Manner made graphics actually interesting.  I mean, projecting views and dimensioning drawings is not exactly thrilling.  Manner was personable and funny in lecture and also very helpful during office hours.  Keep up with HW and you'll do fine.  Open book final was nice...
Seems like a nice guy, definitely approachable. I found the class to be pretty easy so never had reason to visit office hours, but I'm sure he'd be happy to help if you needed it.
Anyone who gives Prof Manner a bad review is a puss. Go to class, go to lab, pay attention and get and A. No problem. Give him respect and he will respect you.
He wasn't bad at all; his exams were based off of the homework that you could get easily done in lab.  Also, the exams themselves weren't hard, and he didn't have a final.

Fair grader, but tough. Fairly easy to get an AB on every assignment but it is tough to improve your "technique" grade. Exams can be rough, but are usually curved. Can make you wish you didnt ask questions some times by ridiculing you, etc.

Stop by his office hours and ask questions, get to know him a little bit.  He made time to explain stuff to me and even helped me out on a project a couple semesters after 232.  232 lectures are tough to follow; lot of theory that's uninteresting.  Labs are good though, do most of the learning there.  Exams were do-able.  Kim is a fair grader too.
Thinks he knows everything.  Very unhelpful when answering questions.
He's a good guy.  He doesn't put up with people's bs but if you need the help he's willing to go out of his way to explain things.
Very down to earth guy. His class and tests and grading are fair.  Material is very clear and understandable. I enjoyed learning from him quite  a bit.
No Comments
No Comments

A bit overweight.  His assignment instructions are awful, and apparently he hasn't heard of proofreading.  Lots of useless information and irrelevent computer jargon that you will definately never see again.
